Shape classes

All of the shapes that can be instantiated are a concrete subclass of the `Object` abstract base class. The subclasses (hereafter ‘shapes’) are listed below. Note that while the constructor format is the same for each of the subclasses

Object class

class object.Object(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)

Abstract base class that can not be instantiated.

abstract __init__(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)

Constructor that acts as template. Can never be directly called.

Parameters

  • model (Model) – The instance of Model object shape is injected into.

  • vp (float) – Homogenous p-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • vs (float) – Homogenous s-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • rho (float) – Homogenous density for cylinder.

  • dim (5-element list or numpy array) – Dimensions of the cylinder. These must be given in the following order: [h, rad, theta, phi, expand_int] where h is the length of the cylinder, rad is the radius of the cylinder, theta and phi are rotation angles away from the major axis and expand_int is an integer value with which to scale the grid in which the shape is searched for. See notes on expand_int below.

  • loc (3-element list or numpy array. Defaults to None and can be updated later using `set_loc()`.) – [x,y,z] of centre of cylinder.

__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

set_loc(centre)

Set location of centre of object.

Parameters

centre (3-element array/list) – Centre [x, y, z]

update_rho(new_rho)

Updates density value.

Parameters

new_rho (float) – New density value.

update_vp(new_vp)

Updates Vp value.

Parameters

new_vp (float) – New Vp value.

update_vs(new_vs)

Updates Vs value.

Parameters

new_vs (float) – New Vs value.

Concrete subclasses class

Cylinder

class cylinder.Cylinder(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None, major_axis='X')
__init__(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None, major_axis='X')
Parameters

  • model (Model) – The instance of Model object shape is injected into.

  • vp (float) – Homogenous p-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • vs (float) – Homogenous s-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • rho (float) – Homogenous density for cylinder.

  • dim (5-element list or numpy array) – Dimensions of the cylinder. These must be given in the following order: [h, rad, theta, phi, expand_int] where h is the length of the cylinder, rad is the radius of the cylinder, theta and phi are rotation angles away from the major axis and expand_int is an integer value with which to scale the grid in which the shape is searched for. See notes on expand_int below.

  • loc (3-element list or numpy array) – [x,y,z] of centre of cylinder.

  • major_axis (str) – Either ‘X’, ‘Y’ or ‘Z’. Specifies the axis of symmetry for the cylinder.

_in_shape_condition(rot_coords)

Checks if coordinates are within cylinder.

Parameters

rot_coords (Numpy array or list) – Rotated coordinates to be checked

Returns

bool

set_dimensions(dimensions)

Set dimensions for cylinder.

Parameters

dimensions – 5-element array/list. These must be given in the following order: [h, rad, theta, phi, expand_int] where h is the length of the cylinder, rad is the radius of the cylinder, theta and phi are rotation angles away from the major axis and expand_int is an integer value with which to scale the grid in which the shape is searched for. See notes on expand_int below.

Ellipsoid

class ellipsoid.Ellipsoid(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)
__init__(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)
Parameters

  • model (Model) – The instance of Model object shape is injected into.

  • vp (float) – Homogenous p-wave velocity for ellipsoid.

  • vs (float) – Homogenous s-wave velocity for ellipsoid.

  • rho (float) – Homogenous density for ellipsoid.

  • dim (single value, or 6-element list/array) – Dimensions of the ellipsoid. If single value then no rotation and all radii are equal (sphere). If 6 elements, these must be given in the following order: [rad_x, rad_y, rad_z, theta, phi, expand_int] where the first 3 elements are the radii in each direction, theta and phi are rotation angles away from the x and z aces and expand_int is an integer value with which to scale the grid in which the shape is searched for. See notes on expand_int below.

  • loc (3-element list or numpy array) – [x,y,z] of centre of ellipsoid.

_in_shape_condition(rot_coords)

Checks if coordinates are within ellipsoid.

Parameters

rot_coords (Numpy array or list) – Rotated coordinates to be checked

Returns

bool

set_dimensions(dimensions)

Set dimensions for ellipsoid.

Parameters

dimensions (float/int or 6-element array/list) – Either single value or 6-element array/list. See constructor for details.

Sphere

class sphere.Sphere(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)
__init__(model, vp, vs, rho, dim, loc=None)

Constructor for sphere object.

Parameters

  • model (Model) – The instance of Model object shape is injected into.

  • vp (float) – Homogenous p-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • vs (float) – Homogenous s-wave velocity for cylinder.

  • rho (float) – Homogenous density for cylinder.

  • dim (float) – Radius of sphere.

  • loc (3-element list or numpy array) – [x,y,z] of centre of cylinder.
